thread.title: Speculation the UK could be about to have a second EU Referendum

author: Keiran Southern
title: Speculation the UK could be about to have a second EU Referendum
text:
News Speculation the UK could be about to have a second EU Referendum A potential hung parliament has led to suggestions the country could be forced to head back to the polls to once again vote on the EU Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Britain could be “looking down the barrel of a second referendum” on Brexit, the former leader of UKIP has warned. 
The General Election has so far failed to deliver the decisive Conservative majority many predicted, with exit polls suggesting the country could be heading for a hung parliament. 
Prime Minister Theresa May ’s entire reason for calling the snap election was to increase her mandate so her party could confidently negotiate Brexit. 
But Mrs May looks to have failed in her aim, which could lead to anti-Brexit parties forming a coalition. 
Or if the Conservatives remain the biggest party but without a large majority, Mrs May could be left to rely on the votes of other parties, who have criticised her Brexit stance so far. Read More General Election 2017 North East results in full: How North East constituencies voted 
Former UKIP leader Farage appeared on the BBC to give his thoughts on how votes were stacking up across the country. 
Mr Farage, who since the EU referendum last summer has taken a step back from frontline politics, was asked if he would make a return if Brexit was threatened. 
He replied: “I would have absolutely no choice but to do exactly that.” Nigel Farage (Photo: Yui Mok/PA Wire) 
Mr Farage then added: “We may be looking down the barrel of a second referendum.” 
The British Government was set to enter Brexit talks within the next fortnight after triggering Article 50, which set a two-year limit for negotiations to be completed. Read More
